result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell A Radziuk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber for employment.  May travel to State of Illinois for employment. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Firearm warning given. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

records.addlTxt:
from defense re: Huber
Defense filed in the wrong case therefore sent to the wrong Judge.  No action taken, the defendant has been released.
Does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

9:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mitchell A Radziuk in court.  Attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec III in court for Mitchell A Radziuk. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Deft. to plea to Ct. 1, dri Ct. 2.  Joint recommendation of a fine plus costs.

PLEA: G
BTC: GUILTY.  Ct. 2: DRI.
Parties are willing to waive PSI and are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

BTC: Ct. 1: 10 days RCJ with Huber for employment and is able to travel to State of Illinois for his employment, 3 days CFTS.  Report to RCJ on June 16, 2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Repay costs and surcharges in 90 days.  FTP will result in a civil judgment.
DNA sample.

FAW/VOTE.

CASE RECALLED AT 10:21 A.M. - SAME APPEARANCES.
Defense counsel requests 3 days credit.
BTC: Credit of 3 days ordered.  Defendant may travel to State of Illinois for his employment.

1:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Mitchell A Radziuk appeared in court. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defendant is indicating he wants to represent himself in this case.
Defendant states he cannot afford counsel at this time.  Defendant is not eligible for SPD.
Defendant states he would like to represent himself.
DSAT:
Mitchell Radziuk.
Court conducts colloquy with defendant regarding representation of himself and his right to have an attorney.
BTC: Defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently has waived his right to a counsel and will be allowed to represent himself in this matter. Defendant to go to SPD again and reapply and also given paperwork for court appointed counsel.
Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

from SPD, defendant not eligible for services.
from SPD, defendant not eligible for services.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken and to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Fingerprinting hours are Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, 9:00 A.M. - 11:00 A.M. or between 1:00 P.M. - 4:00 P.M.  DNA hours are Monday through Friday between 9:00 A.M. - 11:30 A.M. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

COURT REPORTER - DIGITALLY RECORDED.
